page.title: 12Bromley College
page.content: Bromley College is one of the oldest buildings in Bromley being used for its original purpose.In 1666 Dr.John Warner,Bishop of Rochester died and left money to build a college"As good as hands could make it"to house twenty widows of Church of England Clergymen. Sir Christopher Wren is thought to have designed the four storey houses built,with a chapel,round a quadrangle. Extensions were added in 1788 and 1821 and the chapel has been built three times.In 1972 the houses were converted into flats and a common room,laundry and shop were made.Retired Clergy and their wives or widows now live there. The college is administered by Trustees who appoint a Chaplain as warden,a nurse and home helps to aid the members .This is now sheltered accomodation and continues the care begun by John Warner 320 years ago.
